executorImage.description: Allows overriding the default executor image with a custom image. E.g. 'pulumi/pulumi-nodejs:latest'

repoUrl.description: The repository URL to use for git settings. Should not be specified if there are `gitHub` settings for this deployment.

gitAuth.description: Git authentication configuration for this deployment. Should not be specified if there are `gitHub` settings for this deployment.

branch.description: The branch to deploy. One of either `branch` or `commit` must be specified.

commit.description: The commit to deploy. One of either `branch` or `commit` must be specified.

repoDir.description: The directory within the repository where the Pulumi.yaml is located.

pulumiservice:index:DeploymentSettingsGi.description: Git source settings for a deployment.

sshAuth.description: SSH auth for git authentication. Only one of `personalAccessToken`, `sshAuth`, or `basicAuth` must be defined.

basicAuth.description: Basic auth for git authentication. Only one of `personalAccessToken`, `sshAuth`, or `basicAuth` must be defined.

deleteAfterDestroy.description: Whether the stack should be deleted after it is destroyed.

region.description: The region of the GCP project.

tokenLifetime.description: The lifetime of the temporary credentials in “XhYmZs” format.

clientId.description: The client ID of the federated workload identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of the federated workload identity.

subscriptionId.description: The subscription ID of the federated workload identity.

pulumiservice:index:Webhook.description:
Pulumi Webhooks allow you to notify external services of events happening within your Pulumi organization or stack. For example, you can trigger a notification whenever a stack is updated. Whenever an event occurs, Pulumi will send an HTTP POST request to all registered webhooks. The webhook can then be used to emit some notification, start running integration tests, or even update additional stacks.

### Import

Pulumi webhooks can be imported using the `id`, which for webhooks is `{org}/{project}/{stack}/{webhook-name}` e.g.,

```sh
 $ pulumi import pulumiservice:index:Webhook my_webhook my-org/my-project/my-stack/4b0d0671
```

name.description: Webhook identifier generated by Pulumi Cloud.

active.description: Indicates whether this webhook is enabled or not.

displayName.description: The friendly name displayed in the Pulumi Cloud.

secret.description: Optional. secret used as the HMAC key. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#headers) for more information.

projectName.description: Name of the project. Only specified if this is a stack or environment webhook.

stackName.description: Name of the stack. Only specified if this is a stack webhook.

environmentName.description: Name of the environment. Only specified if this is an environment webhook.

format.description: Format of the webhook payload. Can be either `raw`, `slack`, `ms_teams` or `pulumi_deployments`. Defaults to `raw`.

filters.description: Optional set of filters to apply to the webhook. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#filters) for more information.

groups.description: Optional set of filter groups to apply to the webhook. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#groups) for more information.

active.description: Indicates whether this webhook is enabled or not.

displayName.description: The friendly name displayed in the Pulumi Cloud.

secret.description: Optional. secret used as the HMAC key. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#headers) for more information.

projectName.description: Name of the project. Only specified if this is a stack or environment webhook.

stackName.description: Name of the stack. Only needed if this is a stack webhook.

environmentName.description: Name of the environment. Only specified if this is an environment webhook.

format.description: Format of the webhook payload. Can be either `raw` or `slack`. Defaults to `raw`.

filters.description: Optional set of filters to apply to the webhook. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#filters) for more information.

groups.description: Optional set of filter groups to apply to the webhook. See [webhook docs](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/intro/pulumi-service/webhooks/#groups) for more information.

pulumiservice:index:DeploymentSettings.description:
Deployment settings configure Pulumi Deployments for a stack.

### Import

Deployment settings can be imported using the `id`, which for deployment settings is `{org}/{project}/{stack}` e.g.,

```sh
 $ pulumi import pulumiservice:index:DeploymentSettings my_settings my-org/my-project/my-stack
```

executorContext.description: Settings related to the deployment executor.

sourceContext.description: Settings related to the source of the deployment.

operationContext.description: Settings related to the Pulumi operation environment during the deployment.

agentPoolId.description: The agent pool identifier to use for the deployment.

cacheOptions.description: Dependency cache settings for the deployment

operationContext.description: Settings related to the Pulumi operation environment during the deployment.

cacheOptions.description: Dependency cache settings for the deployment

pulumiservice:index:OidcIssuer.description: Register an OIDC Provider to establish a trust relationship between third-party systems like GitHub Actions and Pulumi Cloud, obviating the need to store a hard-coded Pulumi Cloud token in systems that need to run Pulumi commands or consume Pulumi Cloud APIs. Instead of a hard-coded, static token that must be manually rotated, trusted systems are granted temporary Pulumi Cloud tokens on an as-needed basis, which is more secure than static tokens.

name.description: Issuer name.

maxExpirationSeconds.description: The maximum duration of the Pulumi access token working after an exchange, specified in seconds.

thumbprints.description: The thumbprints of issuer's TLS certificates. By default, Pulumi will store the thumbprint of the certificate used to serve the OpenID configuration. If the provider uses multiple certificates to serve content, it is required to manually configure these.

policies.description: The authorization policies for this Oidc Issuer.

name.description: Issuer name.

maxExpirationSeconds.description: The maximum duration of the Pulumi access token working after an exchange, specified in seconds.

thumbprints.description: The thumbprints of issuer's TLS certificates. By default, Pulumi will store the thumbprint of the certificate used to serve the OpenID configuration. If the provider uses multiple certificates to serve content, it is required to manually configure these.

policies.description: The auth policies for this Oidc Issuer.

scheduleId.description: Schedule ID of the created rotation schedule, assigned by Pulumi Cloud.

pulumiservice:index:PolicyGroup.description: A Policy Group allows you to apply policy packs to a set of stacks in your organization.

name.description: The name of the policy group.

organizationName.description: The name of the Pulumi organization the policy group belongs to.

entityType.description: The entity type for the policy group. Valid values are 'stacks' or 'accounts'. Defaults to 'stacks'.

mode.description: The mode for the policy group. Valid values are 'audit' (reports violations) or 'preventative' (blocks operations). Defaults to 'audit'.

stacks.description: List of stack references that belong to this policy group.

policyPacks.description: List of policy packs applied to this policy group.
